intro: Cota coelopoda var. longiloba, commonly known as the long-stemmed cota, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically features slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
